title: Robot Control System Design and Disturbance Control Methodology

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of robotics, basic control theory concepts, and programming skills (Python/MATLAB)
context.additional_context: A course where preservice teachers explore practical applications of robotic control systems and cultivate the ability to design disturbance control algorithms.

learning_goals: Analyze dynamic and static performance requirements of robotic manipulators and establish disturbance control strategies
Implement a hybrid control system combining Sliding Mode Control (SMC) and Active Disturbance Rejection Control (ADRC) techniques in simulation environments
Improve control performance by applying disturbance estimation using an Extended State Observer (ESO) and neural network-based parameter optimization methodologies
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
